question: Light of energy E falls normally on a metal of work function <katex>$\frac{E}{3}$</katex>. The kinetic energies (K) of the photo electrons are
explanation: Maximum kinetic energy <katex>$K_{max} = E - \text{Work Function} = E - E/3 = 2E/3$</katex>.
The kinetic energies of emitted electrons range from 0 (electrons from deep inside) to <katex>$K_{max}$</katex>.
